alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 413 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Dove Creek, or 35 miles southeast of Monticello. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Cahone. This includes U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 42 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
